com.analog.lyric.collect

Class Selection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.collect.Selection

  • public abstract class Selection
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides efficient implementations of variants of the selection problem.

    The selection problem involves efficiently finding the nth element in a set of unordered elements for some ordering relation. Obviously this can be done trivially by sorting, which requires O(n log n) operations, but this class implements an algorithm that takes O(n) time.

    Since:
    0.06

      • findFirstKIndices

        public static int[] findFirstKIndices(double[] array,
                      int k)
        Returns the indices of the k lowest elements.

        Returns a newly allocated array of the indices of the k lowest elements in natural order.

        Parameters:
        array - is a non-empty array in any order.
        k - is in the range [1, array.length]

      • select

        public static double select(double[] array,
            int k)
        Returns the kth element in array in natural order.

        Returns index of kth element in natural order.

        Parameters:
        array - a non-empty array in any order.

      • selectMutably

        public static double selectMutably(double[] array,
                   int k)
        Returns the kth element in array in natural order.

        Returns index of kth element in natural order.

        The array will be rearranged so that the kth element is at position k and all elements less than the kth element will be before it in the array.

        Parameters:
        array - a non-empty array in any order.
        k - a number in the range [0, array.length-1]
